snippet: The capture of Miguel Ángel Treviño Morales, the leader of the Zetas drug cartel, was a retort from Mexico’s government to questions over whether it would go after top organized crime leaders.
abstract: Miguel Angel Trevino Morales, leader of the Zetas, one of Mexico’s most violent and feared drug organizations, is captured by Mexican marines in a city near the Texas border; arrest is seen as response from Mexico's new government to questions over whether it will go after top organized crime leaders.

byline.contributor: Ginger Thompson contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The capture of Miguel Ángel Treviño Morales, the leader of the Zetas drug cartel, was a retort from Mexico’s government to questions over whether it would go after top organized crime leaders.

headline.main: Drug Kingpin Is Captured in Mexico Near Border
headline.print_headline: Leader of Brutal Drug Gang Is Captured in Mexico
